title: Track Awesome Browser Extensions for Github Updates Daily
_seo_title: Track Awesome Browser Extensions for Github (stefanbuck/awesome-browser-extensions-for-github) Updates Daily - Track Awesome List
description: A collection of awesome browser extensions for GitHub.

items.title: Awesome Browser Extensions for Github Updates on Aug 18, 2024
items.content_text: ### [Advanced GitHub Notifier (⭐82)](https://github.com/freaktechnik/advanced-github-notifier) Shows notifications when you get a new notification on GitHub and provides quick access to all notifications in a popup. Installs: 113 | Stars: 79 | Last update: 2 Jun 2023 ### [Contributors on GitHub (⭐482)](https://github.com/hzoo/contributors-on-github) Show the # of PRs and other contributors stats in the Issues/PRs tab. Can be helpful for maintainers that want to know if it's a contributor's first PR. Installs: 6 | Stars: 467 | Last update: 1 Mar 2021 ### [Enhanced GitHub (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/softvar/enhanced-github) Displays size of each file, download link and an option of copying file contents directly to clipboard Installs: 626 | Stars: 2071 | Last update: 3 Jun 2024 ### [GIFs for GitHub (⭐210)](https://github.com/N1ck/gifs-for-github) Easily search GIPHY to add a GIF into any GitHub comment box. Installs: 519 | Stars: 184 | Last update: 18 Jan 2024 ### [Git History (⭐14k)](https://github.com/pomber/git-history) Quickly browse the history of a file from any git repository. Installs: 192 | Stars: 13534 | Last update: 13 Oct 2023 ### [GitHub Code Folding (⭐292)](https://github.com/noam3127/github-code-folding) Code folding - the ability to selectively hide and display sections of a code - is an invaluable feature in many text editors and IDEs. Now, developers can utilize that same style code-folding while poring over source code on the web in GitHub. Works for any type of indentation- spaces or tabs. Installs: 104 | Stars: 289 | Last update: 25 Apr 2024 ### [GitHub Hovercard (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/Justineo/github-hovercard) Neat hovercards for GitHub. Installs: 18634 | Stars: 1822 | Last update: n/a ### [GitHub Issue Link Status (⭐301)](https://github.com/fregante/github-issue-link-status) Colorize issue and PR links to see their status (open, closed, merged). Installs: 92 | Stars: 299 | Last update: 30 Jun 2024 ### [GitHub Writer (⭐395)](https://github.com/ckeditor/github-writer) This extension adds the simplicity of WYSIWYG editing to issues, comments, pull requests, wikis and discussions in GitHub. It accepts Markdown input and offers productive writing, starting with tables. Installs: 114 | Stars: 379 | Last update: 10 Apr 2024 ### [GitZip for github (⭐41)](https://github.com/GitZip/chrome-extension) It can make the sub-directories and files of github repository as zip and download it Installs: 3358 | Stars: 38 | Last update: 21 Aug 2023 ### [Le Git Graph (⭐4.8k)](https://github.com/NirmalScaria/le-git-graph) Browser extension to add git graph to GitHub website. Installs: 449 | Stars: 3313 | Last update: 6 Aug 2024 ### [Lovely forks (⭐638)](https://github.com/musically-ut/lovely-forks) See forks with the most stars under the names of repositories. Installs: 300 | Stars: 596 | Last update: 30 Mar 2024 ### [Material Icons for Github (⭐655)](https://github.com/Claudiohbsantos/github-material-icons-extension) Show Material icons for files/folders in repository file viewer. Display the same icons from vscode-material-icon-theme VSCode extension. Installs: 792 | Stars: 491 | Last update: 11 Aug 2024 ### [Notifications Preview for GitHub (⭐147)](https://github.com/tanmayrajani/notifications-preview-github) A Chrome and Firefox extension to quickly see your notifications in a popup without leaving the current page. Installs: 58 | Stars: 141 | Last update: 16 Aug 2024 ### [Notifier for GitHub (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/notifier-for-github) Displays your GitHub notifications unread count. Supports GitHub Enterprise and an option to only show unread count for issues you're participating in. You can click the icon to quickly see your unread notifications. Installs: 518 | Stars: 1821 | Last update: 24 Apr 2024 ### [OctoLinker (⭐5.3k)](https://github.com/OctoLinker/OctoLinker) OctoLinker is the easiest and best way to navigate between files and projects on GitHub. It supports languages such as JavaScript, Ruby, Go, PHP, JAVA and more. It works with package.json as well as with Gemfiles. Installs: 12901 | Stars: 5263 | Last update: 13 Nov 2022 ### [Octotree (⭐23k)](https://github.com/ovity/octotree) Useful for developers who frequently read source in GitHub and do not want to download or checkout too many repositories. Installs: 37142 | Stars: 22752 | Last update: 9 Jun 2024 ### [Open GitHub file links in IDE (⭐75)](https://github.com/lmichelin/open-github-links-in-ide) This browser extension allows you to open files in your IDE directly from GitHub, assuming the repository you are working on is cloned on your computer. When a fragment of a file is displayed, your IDE opens the file and puts the cursor at the desired line. Installs: 34 | Stars: 71 | Last update: 23 Sep 2023 ### [PR Monitor (⭐120)](https://github.com/fwouts/prmonitor) Helps you keep track of incoming and outgoing PRs, and notifies you when you receive a pull request on GitHub. Installs: 33 | Stars: 117 | Last update: 21 Jun 2023 ### [Refined GitHub (⭐29k)](https://github.com/refined-github/refined-github) Extension that simplifies the GitHub interface and adds useful features. Installs: 8201 | Stars: 24024 | Last update: 13 Aug 2024 ### [Sourcegraph](https://github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph/tree/main/client/browser) The Sourcegraph browser extension gives GitHub IDE-like powers when you're viewing code, pull requests, and diffs: 1. Go to definition 2. Find references 3. Powerful code search with regexp matching, diff searches, and other filters 4. Hover tooltips 5. File tree navigation Installs: 837 | Stars: 10035 | Last update: 14 Apr 2023 ### [eesel: The new tab for GitHub](https://www.eesel.app/) All your issues, PRs, repos and other work documents right in your new tab Installs: 113 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a ### [gitako - github file tree (⭐2.5k)](https://github.com/enixcoda/gitako) file tree for github, and more than that. Installs: 299 | Stars: n/a | Last update: 7 Jul 2024 ### [gitpod - dev environments in a browser tab (⭐164)](https://github.com/gitpod-io/browser-extension) gitpod streamlines developer workflows by providing ready-to-code development environments in your browser - powered by vs code. Installs: 2280 | Stars: 143 | Last update: 21 Jun 2024 ### [npmhub (⭐795)](https://github.com/npmhub/npmhub) When viewing a repository on github.com that has a package.json file, this extension will introspect the dependencies in package.json and display links and description for each dependency, just below the repo's README. Installs: 72 | Stars: 758 | Last update: 26 Jul 2024

Advanced GitHub Notifier (⭐82)

Shows notifications when you get a new notification on GitHub and provides quick access to all notifications in a popup.

GitHub Code Folding (⭐292)

Code folding - the ability to selectively hide and display sections of a code - is an invaluable feature in many text editors and IDEs. Now, developers can utilize that same style code-folding while poring over source code on the web in GitHub. Works for any type of indentation- spaces or tabs.

OctoLinker is the easiest and best way to navigate between files and projects on GitHub. It supports languages such as JavaScript, Ruby, Go, PHP, JAVA and more. It works with package.json as well as with Gemfiles.

This browser extension allows you to open files in your IDE directly from GitHub, assuming the repository you are working on is cloned on your computer. When a fragment of a file is displayed, your IDE opens the file and puts the cursor at the desired line.

The Sourcegraph browser extension gives GitHub IDE-like powers when you're viewing code, pull requests, and diffs:

  1. Go to definition
  2. Find references
  3. Powerful code search with regexp matching, diff searches, and other filters
  4. Hover tooltips

items.title: Awesome Browser Extensions for Github Updates on Aug 17, 2024
items.content_text: ### [GitHub Recommender (⭐61)](https://github.com/IndexStorm/git-rec-ext/) Lists repositories that are similar to the one being viewed Installs: 29 | Stars: 49 | Last update: 10 Aug 2022 ### [GitHub User Languages (⭐48)](https://github.com/freyamade/github-user-languages) Generates a pie chart on user profile pages displaying a breakdown of what languages they have used in their repositories. Installs: 41 | Stars: 47 | Last update: 25 Sep 2023 ### [Isometric Contributions (⭐3.6k)](https://github.com/jasonlong/isometric-contributions) Allows you to toggle between the normal GitHub contribution chart and an isometric pixel art version. Installs: 10000 | Stars: 3486 | Last update: n/a ### [Module Linker (⭐253)](https://github.com/fiatjaf/module-linker) An extension that creates direct links to imported modules, external or internal, on source code on GitHub. Supports multiple languages, including common ones like Rust, Go, Python and Ruby, but also odd ones like Nim, Haskell, Julia and Elm. Installs: 36 | Stars: 250 | Last update: 27 Nov 2019 ### [Render Whitespace on GitHub (⭐77)](https://github.com/glebm/render-whitespace-on-github) Are they tabs? Are they spaces? How many? Never wonder again! Renders spaces as `·` and tabs as `→` in all the code on GitHub. Installs: 22 | Stars: 76 | Last update: 25 Apr 2024
items.content_html:
GitHub Recommender (⭐61)

Lists repositories that are similar to the one being viewed

Installs: 29 | Stars: 49 | Last update: 10 Aug 2022

GitHub User Languages (⭐48)

Generates a pie chart on user profile pages displaying a breakdown of what languages they have used in their repositories.

Installs: 41 | Stars: 47 | Last update: 25 Sep 2023

Isometric Contributions (⭐3.6k)

Allows you to toggle between the normal GitHub contribution chart and an isometric pixel art version.

Installs: 10000 | Stars: 3486 | Last update: n/a

Module Linker (⭐253)

An extension that creates direct links to imported modules, external or internal, on source code on GitHub. Supports multiple languages, including common ones like Rust, Go, Python and Ruby, but also odd ones like Nim, Haskell, Julia and Elm.

Installs: 36 | Stars: 250 | Last update: 27 Nov 2019

Render Whitespace on GitHub (⭐77)

Are they tabs? Are they spaces? How many? Never wonder again! Renders spaces as · and tabs as → in all the code on GitHub.

Installs: 22 | Stars: 76 | Last update: 25 Apr 2024

items.title: Awesome Browser Extensions for Github Updates on Jun 05, 2024
items.content_text: ### [GitHub Highlight Selected (⭐144)](https://github.com/Nuclides/github-highlight-selected) Highlight selected word in GitHub source view like Sublime Text. Installs: 1000 | Stars: 144 | Last update: n/a ### [OctoPermalinker (⭐29)](https://github.com/josephfrazier/octopermalinker) OctoPermalinker is a browser extension that searches GitHub comments/files for links to files on branches, and adds a link to where the branch pointed when the comment/file was made/updated. This helps you avoid following a link that was broken after being posted. For context, here's some discussion about broken GitHub links: [Don't link to line numbers in GitHub](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=8046710). For example, suppose you're looking at a gist that links to a file on the master branch of a repo. At the time the gist was made, the link worked, but if the file gets removed, the link is broken. OctoPermalinker uses the gist creation date to add a permalink that still works. Installs: 232 | Stars: 27 | Last update: n/a
items.content_html:
GitHub Highlight Selected (⭐144)

Highlight selected word in GitHub source view like Sublime Text.

Installs: 1000 | Stars: 144 | Last update: n/a

OctoPermalinker (⭐29)

OctoPermalinker is a browser extension that searches GitHub comments/files for links to files on branches, and adds a link to where the branch pointed when the comment/file was made/updated. This helps you avoid following a link that was broken after being posted. For context, here's some discussion about broken GitHub links: Don't link to line numbers in GitHub.

For example, suppose you're looking at a gist that links to a file on the master branch of a repo. At the time the gist was made, the link worked, but if the file gets removed, the link is broken. OctoPermalinker uses the gist creation date to add a permalink that still works.

Installs: 232 | Stars: 27 | Last update: n/a

items.title: Awesome Browser Extensions for Github Updates on Feb 12, 2024
items.content_text: ### [Autoviewed (⭐10)](https://github.com/Luismahou/autoviewed) Removes clutter from your pull request by automatically marking as viewed files that aren't worth reviewing. Installs: 39 | Stars: 8 | Last update: n/a ### [GitHub CSV Diff (⭐5)](https://github.com/banyan/github-csv-diff) GitHub provides a page that only shows diffs with a .diff at the end of the URL of the pull request. This browser extension makes it easier to view csv diffs by using daff on that page. Installs: 34 | Stars: 4 | Last update: n/a ### [GitHub Npm Stats (⭐60)](https://github.com/katranci/github-npm-stats) Displays npm package stats on GitHub Installs: 606 | Stars: 57 | Last update: n/a ### [Github Saved Filters](https://www.producthunt.com/posts/github-saved-filters) Create, save, edit, pin, search and delete filters that you commonly use on the Github Issues and Pull Requests pages. You are able to scope filters to be shown globally (on each repo) or only have them show up on the repo you create them on. Pinning filters is also a feature that this extension allows you to do. So if you have several filters you use daily - you have a way to quickly access them, at the top of your list. Installs: 553 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a ### [Semantic Code Reviews](https://reviewpad.com) Introduces the Explore tab in the pull request interface where you can review changes ordered by importance and see the semantic context surrounding each change. Installs: 36 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a ### [WorkerB for Pull Requests](https://github.com/stefanbuck/awesome-browser-extensions-for-github/blob/main/README.md/undefined) Generate a magic link for your PR and post it on shared Slack channel, to entice reviewers to pick up your PR faster! Installs: 1000 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a ### [ZenHub](https://www.zenhub.com/) ZenHub is the first and only project management suite that works natively within GitHub; enhancing your workflow with features built specifically for startups, fast-moving engineering teams, and the open-source community. The product is a browser extension that injects advanced functionality including real-time drag-and-drop Issue Task Boards, peer feedback via a +1 button, and support for uploading any file type directly into the GitHub interface. ZenHub makes it easy to centralize all processes into GitHub, keeping your team lean and agile. Installs: 70000 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a ### [github.expandinizr (⭐131)](https://github.com/thecodejunkie/github.expandinizr) Add breakpoints at 1400px, 1600px and 1800px for full GitHub experience on large screens. Also removes the truncating of file and directory names in the repository browser. Installs: 2000 | Stars: 131 | Last update: n/a
items.content_html:
Autoviewed (⭐10)

Removes clutter from your pull request by automatically marking as viewed files that aren't worth reviewing.

Installs: 39 | Stars: 8 | Last update: n/a

GitHub CSV Diff (⭐5)

GitHub provides a page that only shows diffs with a .diff at the end of the URL of the pull request. This browser extension makes it easier to view csv diffs by using daff on that page.

Installs: 34 | Stars: 4 | Last update: n/a

GitHub Npm Stats (⭐60)

Displays npm package stats on GitHub

Installs: 606 | Stars: 57 | Last update: n/a

Github Saved Filters

Create, save, edit, pin, search and delete filters that you commonly use on the Github Issues and Pull Requests pages. You are able to scope filters to be shown globally (on each repo) or only have them show up on the repo you create them on. Pinning filters is also a feature that this extension allows you to do. So if you have several filters you use daily - you have a way to quickly access them, at the top of your list.

Installs: 553 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a

Semantic Code Reviews

Introduces the Explore tab in the pull request interface where you can review changes ordered by importance and see the semantic context surrounding each change.

Installs: 36 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a

WorkerB for Pull Requests

Generate a magic link for your PR and post it on shared Slack channel, to entice reviewers to pick up your PR faster!

Installs: 1000 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a

ZenHub

ZenHub is the first and only project management suite that works natively within GitHub; enhancing your workflow with features built specifically for startups, fast-moving engineering teams, and the open-source community. The product is a browser extension that injects advanced functionality including real-time drag-and-drop Issue Task Boards, peer feedback via a +1 button, and support for uploading any file type directly into the GitHub interface. ZenHub makes it easy to centralize all processes into GitHub, keeping your team lean and agile.

Installs: 70000 | Stars: n/a | Last update: n/a

github.expandinizr (⭐131)

Add breakpoints at 1400px, 1600px and 1800px for full GitHub experience on large screens. Also removes the truncating of file and directory names in the repository browser.

Installs: 2000 | Stars: 131 | Last update: n/a

items.content_text: ### [Gifhub Pull Request (⭐22)](https://github.com/bguzmanrio/gifhub-pull-request) Find the best GIFs for your awesome pull requests. Installs: 136 | Stars: 22 | Last update: n/a
items.content_html:
Gifhub Pull Request (⭐22)

Find the best GIFs for your awesome pull requests.

Installs: 136 | Stars: 22 | Last update: n/a
